alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:09PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, southern Jackson, southern Rockcastle and northwestern Clay Counties through 345 PM EST... At 309 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pongo, or 8 miles south of Mount Vernon, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Camp Wildcat, Hazel Patch, Sinks and Wood Creek Lake around 315 PM EST. Lamero, Mershons, Templer, Gauley, Horse Lick, Jep Hill, Donaro, Withers and Hare around 320 PM EST. Parrot, Eberle, Carico, Middlefork, Ardery, Peoples, Cruise, Dango, Victory and Greenmount around 325 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dabolt, Bond, Deese, Olin, Annville, Cornelius, Green Hill, Moores Creek, Shop Branch, Hurley, McKee, Mildred, Tyner, Zekes Point, Herd, Gray Hawk, Settle Store, Privett, Welchburg, Atkinstown, Elian, Nathanton, Maulden, Mummie, Chestnutburg and New Zion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
